column4: I initailly had that problem with this computer... Turns out the SATA controller acts like a IDE controller.. adding all-ide-generic to the boot prompt fixes this
old box.. how old ... if it doesn't have a sata controller all-ide-generic won't do anything
it can boot from CD, so it can obviously read a cd
mine will boot from cd ... then drop to busybox... unless I use the generic ... not sure ... do you know if you have SATA or IDE harddrives?
not sure... ill check on the bios
how can i enable the generc mode?
when you get to the pretty page where it asks for language you can add other options to the boot line ... add all-ide-generic
but now at least  dmesg stops in a different level
different ways of saying the same thing
not sure what to tell you, and I have to go,,, good luck
